description:
Fresh new look. Same great taste. Chicago's premium pizzeria. Est. 1947. See baking instructions. All natural (Minimally processed, no artificial ingredients). Made from scratch. No preservatives. After the winning run from a nearby baseball game shattered their front window in 1923, my grandparents decided to name their Chicago tavern Home Run Inn. Together, in 1947, my father Nick Perrino, and my grandmother, Mary Grittani created our legendary pizza recipe as it is known today. By the late 1970's, we had become one of the first iconic pizzerias in Chicago. In hopes of better serving our loyal customers, we began preparing frozen pizzas in our own unique way. All our ingredients are prepared from scratch daily and then par-baked giving you the highest quality pizza with the freshest flavor possible. Today, Home Run Inn continues to be a family owned and operated business dedicated to serving customers the original pizza recipe that my father and grandmother created in 1947. I hope our pizza provides as many great memories for you as it has for us. - Joe Perrino, CEO. Carton is made from recycled materials. Quality Guarantee: Home Run Inn's commitment to making wholesome and delicious products is your guarantee of satisfaction. If for any reason you're not satisfied, please let us know. Send the upc code, best by date and store name from where the pizza was purchased to customer service at the address to the right. We Appreciate Your Comments: 1-800-636-9696; www.HomeRunInnPizza.com.

description:
Made with organic shiitake mushrooms, sweet onions and roasted red peppers. Family owned since 1988. No GMOs: no bioengineered ingredients. Dairy free. After the birth of our daughter Amy in 1987 we found there was a little time to prepare the wholesome nutritious food we normally ate. Realizing there were others like ourselves, we set up Amy's Kitchen to produce delicious, nourishing frozen meals for health-conscious people too busy to cook. We use only the finest natural and organic ingredients and prepare them with the same careful attention in our kitchen as you would in your own home. No meat, fish, shellfish, poultry, eggs or peanuts are ever used in any Amy's products. For anyone looking for a truly special pizza. The hand stretched tender crust made from organic flour and extra virgin olive oil is covered with roasted, toasted and marinated organic onions, shiitake mushrooms, red bell peppers & marinated artichoke hearts. Then it's fully baked so that the flavor soaks into the crust. It's great party food cut into appetizer size pieces and it will remind you of the finest focaccia. Irresistible! Everyone in our family loves pizza: for dinner, lunch, snacks, parties - even for breakfast. And everyone has a favorite. Amy and her friends like their pizzas with just cheese & sauce, and so did her grandma Clarice. Her dad goes for a spinach topping. Her mom & grandma Nonny prefers a cheeseless pizza with lots of veggies. So we decided to offer a variety of toppings. One thing everyone agreed on was that the crust had to be excellent. Not hard, soggy or thin like cardboard. So we created a crust that is light, tender and tasty. The dough is made from organic Old Mill flour with a touch of olive oil to give it flavor and tenderness. Then it's hand stretched and baked. After that we carefully add the toppings in perfect proportion to the crust. 0 g trans fat. No added MSG. No preservatives. No GMOs - no genetically engineered ingredients. We like hearing from you. If you have any questions or comments, please write to us. Find out more about our products, our company, our family, and what makes Amy's food so special at www.amys.com. Certified organic by QAI. Certified organic: Quality Assurance International. Certified vegan. vegan.org. Carton is made from 100% recycled paperboard. Carton is recyclable. Made in USA.

Minimally processed, no artificial ingredients. It's all natural. Our crust is light, tender and dusted with corn meal for an added depth of flavor. We start with vine-ripened tomatoes, then add a blend of select herbs, and finally combine it with romano cheese to create a smooth, flavorful sauce. Our premium quality toppings are a delicious combination of our signature cheese blend of creamy 100% real mozzarella, parmesan and romano cheeses. 0 grams trans fat per serving. The Connie's Story: It was 1963 - the Beatles first album debuted, gas was 29 cents per gallon, Lawrence of Arabia won Best Picture and zip codes were introduced in the US. From these humble beginnings, Connie's Pizza has grown and evolved into a strong family business. Over the years our classic family recipes have been enjoyed by Chicagoans. Quality is the main ingredient in everything we do at Connie's Pizza. Our great tasting pizza comes from only the finest. All natural (Minimally processed, no artificial ingredients), restaurant ingredients. Today, as the son of the pizza-man, my frozen pizza continues the tradition started by my father over 45 years ago. Pride in our product; pride in our name. Bring home a frozen Connie's Natural Pizza today and taste the tradition! - Marc J. Stolfe, President. description:
Thick rich robust tomato sauce. Wisconsin whole milk mozzarella. Wisconsin parmesan & romano. Sweet Italian sausage. Gargantuan boulders of sausage. Wisconsin cheese. Real. Made with 100% real cheese. Inspected and passed by Department of Agriculture. Our Boss Hog Italian Sausage is pizza perfection! Covered with so many boulders of Italian sausage, our Boss Hog could possibly be illegal in some states. Our individually rolled, never pressed, stone-fired artisan crust struggles to hold the heaping pool of our tongue-popping secret recipe tomato sauce which we craft from the finest tomatoes available. If you think you can handle this assault on your taste buds, bring it on! Scream at us: Screaminsicilian.com. Our Boss Hog Italian sausage is pizza perfection! It starts with the farmers whose faces are as furrowed as the fields they tend. They nurture the wheat that waits anxiously to be milled into fine flour to create our unmatched, stone-fired artisan crust. Each dough ball is individually rolled, never pressed. Pressing dough is cruel, and rolling results in a crust that is perfectly imperfect, yeasty and full of structure. When the crust is ready, we adorn it with generous scoops of our rich & zesty secret-recipe tomato sauce, which we season just so with real garlic. A sauce this good should really be eaten as a meal, but instead we add heaping mounds of Wisconsin whole milk mozzarella cheese and grated aged parmesan and romano cheeses before gargantuan boulders of the finest, most savory Italian sausages are placed atop it all. This is the be-all & end-all of sausage pizza! Questions/comments? Scream at us: 1-855-Y Scream (855-972-7326). Or, check us out at www.Screaminsicilian.com. It's easy being red, white & green.

description:
All natural (minimally processed, no artificial ingredients), pork Italian sausage, oven roasted green peppers, onions, and mushrooms. A Chicago tradition since 1963. Great taste from all natural restaurant quality ingredients. US inspected and passed by Department of Agriculture. It's all natural - Our crust is light, tender and dusted with corn meal for an added depth of flavor. Our signature sauce is a family recipe that has been passed down for generations. We start with vine-ripened tomatoes, then add a blend of select herbs, and finally combine it with romano cheese to create a smooth, flavorful sauce. Our premium quality toppings are a delicious combination of oven roasted green peppers, onions, mushrooms and savory, all natural (minimally processed, no artificial ingredients), lean pork Italian sausage topped with our signature cheese blend of creamy 100% real mozzarella, parmesan and romano cheeses. 0 grams trans fat per serving. The Connie's Story: It was 1963 - the Beatles first album debuted, gas was 29 cents per gallon, Lawrence of Arabia won Best Picture and zip codes were introduced in the US. Meanwhile, on the South Side, my father had just traded his prized 1962 Olds Starfire for a small pizza-joint. From these humble beginnings, Connie's Pizza has grown and evolved into a strong family business. Over the years our classic family recipes have been enjoyed by Chicagoans. Quality is the main ingredient in everything we do at Connie's Pizza. Our great tasting pizza comes from only the finest. All natural (Minimally processed, no artificial ingredients), restaurant ingredients. Today, as the son of the pizza-man, my frozen pizza continues the tradition started by my father over 45 years ago. Pride in our product; pride in our name. Bring home a frozen Connie's Natural Pizza today and taste the tradition! - Marc J. Stolfe, President. 100% satisfaction guarantee. To learn more about our products & great recipe ideas visit our website www.conniesnaturals.com. Visit one of the Connie's Pizza restaurants and see where it all started. See a complete list of locations at www.conniespizza.com.

description:
Thick rich robust tomato sauce. Wisconsin whole milk fresh mozzarella. Wisconsin whole milk mozzarella. Wisconsin parmesan, romano & white cheddar. Ridiculous amounts of cheese! Wisconsin cheese. Real. Made with 100% real cheese. We begin crafting Bessie's Revenge a monument to cheesiness! Gathered and harvested by farmers of the land from the finest purveyors in America's dairyland. Illegal in some states, our individually rolled, never pressed, stone-fired artisan crust struggles to hold the heaping pool of our tongue-popping secret recipe tomato sauce which we craft from the finest tomatoes available. If you think you can handle this assault on your taste buds, bring it on! Scream at us at: Screaminsicilian.com. We begin crafting Bessie's Revenge, a monument to cheesiness, by starting at the bottom - aka our unique, stone-fired artisan crust. Each crust is perfect in its imperfection serving as the ideal host to copious amounts of our zesty secret-recipe sauce. And let's talk sauce. Ours is made lovingly with vine ripened tomatoes that have been kissed by the sun. We then drown those tomatoes in ridiculous amounts of shredded Wisconsin mozzarella and white cheddar and add slices of Wisconsin fresh mozzarella cheese gathered from the finest purveyors in America's dairyland. These people know cheese! Then just when you think we've gone too far, we finish it off with a gentle kiss of grated aged parmesan and romano cheeses, from you guessed it, Wisconsin. Questions/comments? Scream at us: 1-855-Y Scream (855-972-7326). Or, check us out at www.Screaminsicilian.com. It's easy being red, white & green.

description:
The original. Original recipe handmade. We love Ginos! The Gino's east story. Since 1966, Gino's East of Chicago has been serving up legendary deep-dish pizza to Chicagoans and worldwide visitors at their landmark downtown Chicago eatery. Generations of patrons have written their names & noted special moments on the walls which remain today. Lovers of Gino's authentic Chicago deep-dish pizza savor the abundance of fresh ingredients, cheeses, spices, signature pizza sauce and famous golden brown crust. Now you can enjoy that same eating experience with Gino's East frozen deep-dish pizza, just don't write on the walls at home. We hope you'll enjoy all the delicious varieties of Gino's East of Chicago authentic deep-dish pizza now available in your grocer's freezer. We appreciate your comments: www.ginoseastpizza.net.


Storage: Keep frozen. Directions: For best results keep frozen until ready to use. Oven bake from frozen - total prep time is 38 to 45 minutes. 1. Remove pizza from carton, remove and discard plastic wrap. 2. Position oven rack in center of oven and preheat to 425 degrees F. Tip: To avoid spillage, place foil or pan on Lowest rack or bottom of the oven. 3. Place frozen pizza in center and directly on the rack. No pan or stone needed. When baking multiple pizzas, place close to center without touching. 4. Bake 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and sauce bubbles on the top. (Oven bake time may vary. Please make adjustments if needed). 5. Carefully remove pizza from oven without tipping. Tip: Let pizza sit 3 to 5 minutes before cutting. 6. Using a long serrated knife, (no pizza roller please) cut pizza and enjoy! 7. Refrigerate leftover pizza and enjoy up to 48 hours after baking. Oven bake from thawed. 1. If thawed, please bake pizza within 48 hours. Do not re-freeze thawed pizza. 2. Please follow the above baking directions allowing for bake time to decrease 10 to 20 minutes. To avoid spillage, place foil or pan on lowest rack or bottom of the oven. Since ovens vary, bake times may require adjusting. Please bake to best suit your personal preferences in finished pizza. Please Note: Do not refreeze any frozen product that has begun to thaw. If thawed, please keep in refrigerator and bake within 48 hrs. Use of microwave ovens is not recommended. Since ovens vary slightly, final completion of baking should be determined by the dough color (golden brown) and pizza temperature (155 degrees F). Excessive opening of the oven door will affect the above mentioned baking times. Enjoy the pizza!

Italian combination pizza. Thick rich robust tomato sauce. Wisconsin whole milk mozzarella. Italian meatballs. Rough chopped pepperoni. Badda bing badda boom. Wisconsin cheese. Real. Our individually rolled, never pressed, stone-fired artisan crust struggles to hold the heaping pool of our tongue-popping secret recipe tomato sauce which we craft from the finest tomatoes available. If you think you can handle this assault on your taste buds, bring it on! Scream at us at: Screaminsicilian.com. This is the pizza to take with you when you're going to the mattresses, we call it the Mambo Italiano. Our thick and chunky secret-recipe small batch tomato sauce rides shotgun on a stone-fired artisan crust that is made from individually rolled tender balls of dough to create a foundation that could bring mama to tears. Then we badda bing, badda boom this pie with ridiculous amounts of whole milk mozzarella smuggled in, excuse me I mean purchased, from Wisconsin, we know people in the cheese business if you know what I mean. Before you even know what hit you we pull out the big guns, rough-chopped, thick-cut pepperoni and huge, mouthwatering Italian meatballs that throw a bag over your taste buds and go to town on them. We're not saying that this pizza can guarantee your personal safety or prevent your business from burning down - we're just saying you should eat this pizza. Questions/comments? Scream at us: 1-855-Y Scream (855-972-7326). Or, check us out at www.Screaminsicilian.com. It's easy being red, white & green.

Storage: Keep frozen. Directions: Not ready to eat. Cook thoroughly. Baking directions for the perfect DiGiorno pizza & boneless Wyngz: Adjust oven racks to two middle positions. Preheat & bake at 400 degrees F. Keep pizza and boneless wyngz frozen while preheating. Remove pizza and boneless wyngz from box and discard plastic overwrap. Place boneless wyngz on baking sheet. Boneless wyngz package filled by weight. Contains approx. 6-8 pieces. Bake pizza 16 to 18 min. Bake boneless wyngz 23-25 min. Place pizza directly on lower of the two oven racks and boneless wyngz on upper of the two oven racks. Stagger pizza and boneless wyngz. Do not place pizza directly under boneless wyngz in oven. For a Softer Pizza Crust: Preheat and bake at 400 degrees F. Place pizza and boneless wyngz on separate baking sheets. Cook as directed above but lengthen pizza cook time to 18 to 20 minutes. Boneless Wyngz with Pizza: Place boneless wyngz in the oven on upper rack and bake for 7 minutes. Place pizza on lower rack and bake with boneless wyngz for 17 minutes. Remove both and sauce boneless wyngz while pizza cools. Boneless Wyngz as an Appetizer: Bake boneless wyngz in oven on upper rack for 14 minutes. Place pizza on lower rack and bake with boneless wyngz for 10 minutes. Remove, sauce, and enjoy boneless wyngz while pizza bakes an additional 7 minutes. Serving Tip: To cool buffalo flavor, dip boneless wyngz in ranch or blue cheese dressing. Dressing not included. To prepare your perfectly sauced boneless wyngz: Remove sauce packet from box. Let stand at room temperature while pizza and boneless wyngz bake. Tear open packet. Squeeze sauce into a medium size microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High 10 to 15 seconds, or to desired temperature. Do not microwave sauce packet! Carefully remove baked boneless wyngz from baking sheet and place in bowl. Stir gently to coat. Product must be cooked thoroughly to 160 degrees F for food safety and quality. Do not eat pizza or boneless wyngz without cooking. Do not allow pizza or boneless wyngz to thaw. Your oven temperature may vary so adjust baking time & oven temperature as necessary. Pizza is done when cheese is melted & edges are golden brown. Because DiGiorno pizza and boneless wyngz bake up fresh and hot in your oven, please use care when handling. Let pizza stand 4 minutes before enjoying.

Storage: Keep frozen. Directions: Not ready to eat. Cook thoroughly. Baking Directions for the Perfect DiGiorno Pizza & Boneless Wyngz (with no wing meat). Adjust oven racks to two middle positions. Preheat & bake at 400 degrees F. Keep pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) frozen while preheating. Remove pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) from box and discard plastic overwrap. Place boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) on baking sheet. 19 minutes. Bake pizza 17 to 21 min. 24 minutes. Bake boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) 23-25 min. Place pizza directly on lower of the two oven racks and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) on upper of the two oven racks. Stagger pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat). Do not place pizza directly under boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) in oven. For Softer Pizza Crust: Preheat and bake at 400 degrees F. Place pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) on separate baking sheets. Cook as directed but lengthen pizza cook time to 21 to 24 minutes. Boneless Wyngz (with no wing meat) with Pizza: Place boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) in the oven on upper rack and bake for 5 minutes. Place pizza on lower rack and bake with boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) for 19 minutes. Remove both and sauce boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) while pizza cools. Boneless Wyngz (with no wing meat) as an Appetizer: Bake boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) in oven on upper rack for 14 minutes. Place pizza on lower rack and bake with boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) for 10 minutes. Remove, sauce, and enjoy boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) while pizza bakes an additional 9 minutes. To Prepare Your Perfectly Sauced Boneless Wyngz (with no wing meat): Remove sauce packet from box. Let stand at room temperature while pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) bake. Tear open packet. Squeeze sauce into a medium size microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High 10 to 15 seconds, or to desired temperature. Do not microwave sauce packet! Carefully remove baked boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) from baking sheet and place in bowl. Stir gently to coat. Product must be cooked thoroughly to 160 degrees F for food safety and quality. Do not eat pizza or boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) without cooking. Do not allow pizza or boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) to thaw. Your oven temperature may vary so adjust baking time & oven temperature as necessary. Pizza is done when cheese is melted & edges are golden brown. Because DiGiorno pizza and boneless wyngz (with no wing meat) bake up fresh and hot in your oven, please use care when handling. Let pizza stand 4 minutes before enjoying.
